author: Tope Olaiya
title: Enugu ready to become agric hub for investors, says Mbah
text: Enugu State governor, Peter Mbah, has reiterated his administrationâ€™s commitment to making the state an agricultural hub for investors. He made this known while unveiling the Enugu rice at the Ministry of Agriculture and Agro Industrialisation complex in Enugu on Thursday. The governor, represented by his deputy, Ifeanyi Ossai, commended the Commissioner for Agriculture and Agro Industrialisation, Patrick Ubru, for the efforts in making the event a reality. He said, â€œI am impressed by what I see today, it is encouraging, I commend the farmers of Enugu State and with your synergy, support and cooperation to Enugu State Government, production of rice will continue to increase for the benefit of all. This is the development we have been craving for as well as the growth we are praying for. Indeed, our tomorrow is here.â€ He enjoined staff of the ministry to be dedicated to their duties and give maximum support to the commissioner so that the ministry could achieve the mandate and vision of the state for agriculture. Mbah noted that the Enugu rice brand would grow bigger than what it was known for, stressing that the state would soon be known as a rice producing state. He explained that Enugu was now an oil producing state and also doing well i the agricultural sector, saying, â€œThis will help to reduce hunger to zero by 2031.â€™â€™ Earlier, Mr Ubru had commended the governor for his commitment to the rebirth and development of the sector. He stated that the occasion was a testament to their collective efforts in promoting and emphasising the authenticity and originality of the Enugu rice brand. The commissioner stressed that it offered the state an opportunity to showcase the exceptional quality of its locally produced rice and to celebrate the hard work of the farmers. He maintained that the launch was promoting the brand, its originality and also ensuring that farmers had the opportunity to make substantial sales to increase their income. He said that the rice would be sold at the most affordable prices to make the rice accessible to all, to improve their livelihoods and boost their local economy. Ubru noted that the state government had directed his ministry to ensure the establishment of more rice mills across the LGAs with comparative advantage in rice production. â€œThese mills will revolutionise rice processing in our state and also enhance our self-sufficiency and economic growth,â€™â€™ he added. He said this would be achieved through the land space of over 50,000 hectares of rice fields in different locations at Idodo-Owo-Ubagu-Amankanu-Nkerefi-Nara- Ugboka rice fields in Nkanu East LGA.He stated, â€œOthers are Ibiteolo-Mgbagbu Owa rice fields in Ezeagu LGA,Oduma-Nenwe-Okpanku rice fields in Aninri LGA,Adani-Okoro-Ogurugu- Asaba rice fields in Uzo-Uwani LGA and rice fields in Isi-Uzo LGA. He added that Mbahâ€™s vision was to feed Enugu people and make the state the food basket of the nation as demonstrated with the payment of counterpart funds for the donor agricultural-assisted projects. These include the payment of seven years arrears for Agricultural Transformation Agenda Support Program phase -1, the initial payment for the new Livestock Productivity and Resilience Support Project. The three years payment for IFAD assisted Value Chain Development Programme is also part of the payments. The state programme coordinator of IFAD-VCOP, Dr Edward Isiwu, stated that some farmers in Abakaliki went to Nara, Nkerefi, Nomeh and Ubahu to cultivate rice on leased land which they sold as Abakaliki rice. He appealed to the state government to provide them with some land to cultivate rice and help in increasing the production of the grain in the state. 0 Comments [cancel reply](/news/enugu-ready-to-become-agric-hub-for-investors-says-mbah/#respond) You must be logged in to post a comment. author: Press Advantage
title: Wellness Counseling Hosts Ongoing Supportive Mom Group at Montclair Location Every Wednesday Evening | User | dailytimesleader.com
text:
Wellness Counseling , a private therapy practice in New Jersey offering support and empowerment in the Montclair community, is excited to announce the ongoing supportive mom group at its Montclair location. The weekly gatherings aim to provide a safe space for mothers to connect, share experiences, and find solidarity in their journey through parenthood.
Led by professionals Ali Whitney, a Licensed Associate Counselor, and Heather Picinch, a Licensed Social Worker, the Wellness Counseling mom group offers a platform for mothers to seek guidance, gain insights, and foster meaningful connections with fellow moms. Recognizing the immense demands placed on mothers, the program prioritizes self-care, mental wellness, and mutual support.
Scheduled every Wednesday evening at Wellness Counseling's Montclair location, the mom group promises a safe and inclusive environment where mothers can freely express themselves, seek advice, and build a strong support network. The sessions, facilitated by experienced counselors, encourage open dialogue, exploration of challenges, and celebration of triumphs of motherhood.
Additionally, Wellness Counseling recognizes the importance of supporting families as a whole. In conjunction with the mom group, a concurrent program is offered to middle schoolers, providing a nurturing environment where youth can engage with peers, receive support, and develop essential coping skills.
Led by Dana Shabo, a Licensed Clinical Social Worker, and Heather Picinch, a Licensed Social Worker, the middle school community workshop offers a safe space for adolescents to navigate the challenges of adolescence. Through group discussions, activities, and peer interaction, participants are empowered to explore their emotions, build resilience, and develop healthy coping mechanisms.
The dual programming not only supports mothers in their quest for self-care and mental wellness but also provides a valuable resource for families by addressing the unique needs of adolescents during a pivotal stage of development.
Participants in the mom group can rest assured that their children are in capable hands, engaging in meaningful activities and receiving support from qualified professionals. Wellness Counseling is committed to fostering well-being for families in the Montclair community , recognizing that supporting mothers and their children is essential for creating thriving, resilient families.
Registration for the ongoing mom group and middle school community workshop is open to all interested individuals. Those looking to join the supportive mom group or enroll their middle schoolers in the community workshop are encouraged to contact Wellness Counseling at (201) 661-8070.
Wellness Counseling invites the Montclair community to embrace the power of connection, support, and empowerment through its ongoing mom group and middle school community workshop. Together, we can cultivate resilience, foster growth, and thrive as individuals and families.
For more information about Wellness Counseling or their Montclair New Jersey Wednesday night groups, please visit their website at https://www.wellnesscounselingbc.com/ .
About Wellness Counseling:
Wellness Counseling is a private therapy practice specializing in supporting and encouraging children, families, and adults to make flourishing decisions and positive changes in their lives.
Wellness Counseling in New Jersey helps children, teens, couples, families, and adults. Wellness Counseling supports clients going through a difficult transition at home or school, or are experiencing stress, anxiety, depression, or self-doubt. By applying different therapy approaches and techniques, we will alter long-standing behavior patterns and negative perceptions that hold clients back from experiencing a more fulfilling and meaningful life.
Wellness Counseling therapists can partner with guidance counselors, teachers and administrators, pediatricians, school nurses, psychiatrists, and other medical professionals to access the resources patients of all ages and life milestones may need. From managing major transitions like relocating and divorce to improving family dynamics, Wellness Counseling helps clients reconnect with their inner strength, reduce anxiety and conflict, heal their relationships, and rediscover the joy in their lives.
###
For more information about Wellness Counseling, contact the company here:
Wellness Counseling
Wellness Counseling
201-661-8070
info@wellnesscounselingbc.com
470 North Franklin Turnpike
Suite 201
Ramsey, NJ 07446

author: John Sigler
title: Saints WR Chris Olave secures must-see juggling touchdown vs. Falcons
text:
CHRIS OLAVE. You are insane ðŸ¤¯
ðŸ“º @NFLonCBS pic.twitter.com/DhuvvklaSK
â€” New Orleans Saints (@Saints) January 7, 2024
Whew. Chris Olave made one of the plays of the day on this juggling touchdown catch against the Atlanta Falcons â€” somehow keeping his balance while sprinting into the end zone and tracking the football as it deflected from one hand to another.
But the New Orleans Saintsâ€™ star wideout secured the catch to score a go-ahead touchdown. Itâ€™s taken some time for Olave to get in sync with his new quarterback Derek Carr, but heâ€™s finished the year strong and is consistently coming through with tough catches when the team needs them.
And heâ€™s still developing. Olave has made strides this year in fighting for contested catches and running for more yards after the catch. If he can take another step forward in 2024, thereâ€™s no telling how high his ceiling might be.

title: ÃŠtre une femme sous le rÃ©gime taliban ouvre droit au statut de rÃ©fugiÃ©e, annonce la Cour nationale du droit dâ€™asile - L'HumanitÃ©
text: La Cour nationale du droit dâ€™asile (CNDA) a rendu ce 11 juillet 2024, un arrÃªt stipulant que Â« lâ€™ensemble des femmes afghanes Â» ont vocation Ã  obtenir le statut de rÃ©fugiÃ©es en raison de leur genre. [SociÃ©tÃ©](https://www.humanite.fr/sections/societe) Pour la premiÃ¨re fois en droit franÃ§ais, le genre fÃ©minin est reconnu comme ouvrant, en tant que tel, la possibilitÃ© dâ€™ [obtenir la protection asilaire en France](https://www.humanite.fr/monde/afghanistan/les-femmes-afghanes-considerees-comme-refugiees-admet-la-cour-du-droit-dasile). Câ€™est le sens de la dÃ©cision rendue ce 11 juillet par la Cour Nationale du droit dâ€™Asile (CNDA), accordant le statut de rÃ©fugiÃ©es aux Afghanes en raison des persÃ©cutions faites aux femmes dans leur pays [depuis que les talibans y ont pris le pouvoir en 2021](https://www.humanite.fr/monde/afghanistan/deux-ans-apres-cest-une-vie-sans-vie-pour-les-afghanes). RÃ©unie en Grande formation, la cour a constatÃ© que Â« les autoritÃ©s afghanes ont portÃ© atteinte, depuis leur arrivÃ©e au pouvoir le 15 aoÃ»t 2021, aux droits et libertÃ©s fondamentaux des femmes et des jeunes filles afghanes, notamment en les excluant du gouvernement provisoire, en supprimant les institutions et mÃ©canismes de promotion de lâ€™Ã©galitÃ© de genre et de protection contre les violences basÃ©es sur le genre ainsi quâ€™en remettant en cause leur droit Ã  la santÃ©, Ã  lâ€™Ã©ducation et leur libertÃ© dâ€™aller et venir Â». Pour cela, elle sâ€™est appuyÃ©e sur la documentation publique disponible, notamment les rapports du Haut Commissariat des Nations Unies aux droits de lâ€™homme du 20 juin 2023 et du rapporteur spÃ©cial des Nations Unies des 1er septembre 2023 et 13 mai 2024 ainsi que la note dâ€™orientation pour lâ€™Afghanistan de lâ€™agence de lâ€™Union europÃ©enne pour lâ€™asile. Le genre comme un Â« groupe social Â» En France, le droit dâ€™asile repose en premier lieu sur la Convention de GenÃ¨ve de 1951 relative au statut des rÃ©fugiÃ©s. Lâ€™article 1 de ce texte international dispose que Â« le terme â€˜rÃ©fugiÃ©â€™ sâ€™appliquera Ã  toute personne (â€¦) craignant avec raison dâ€™Ãªtre persÃ©cutÃ©e du fait de sa race, de sa religion, de sa nationalitÃ©, de son appartenance Ã  un certain groupe social ou de ses opinions politiques Â». Jusquâ€™alors, mÃªme si la CNDA reconnaissait dÃ©jÃ  lâ€™existence dâ€™un Â« groupe social Â» dans le cas des homosexuels dans certains pays (Mali, Tunisie, Ã‰gypteâ€¦), des femmes voulant se soustraire Ã  un mariage forcÃ© (Mali, Mauritanie, GuinÃ©e, Burkina Fasoâ€¦) ou encore Ã  celles risquant lâ€™excision (Ã‰gypte, Camerounâ€¦), aucun Â« groupe social des femmes Â» nâ€™Ã©tait reconnu. Au-delÃ  du fait dâ€™Ãªtre de sexe fÃ©minin, lâ€™identification du groupe social nÃ©cessite que les femmes soient perÃ§ues de maniÃ¨re diffÃ©rente par la sociÃ©tÃ© environnante et quâ€™elles se voient reconnaÃ®tre une identitÃ© propre dans cette sociÃ©tÃ©, en raison notamment de normes sociales, morales ou juridiques ayant cours dans leur pays dâ€™origine. Câ€™est dÃ©sormais le cas puisque la Cour a jugÃ© quâ€™il rÃ©sulte de lâ€™ensemble de normes juridiques et sociales quâ€™elles ont Ã  subir que Â« les femmes et jeunes filles afghanes sont, dans leur ensemble, perÃ§ues dâ€™une maniÃ¨re diffÃ©rente par la sociÃ©tÃ© afghane et quâ€™elles doivent Ãªtre considÃ©rÃ©es comme appartenant Ã  un groupe social susceptible dâ€™Ãªtre protÃ©gÃ© comme rÃ©fugiÃ© Â». Un tournant jurisprudentiel inspirÃ© dâ€™une dÃ©cision europÃ©enne Â« Cela va uniformiser la jurisprudence pour les annÃ©es Ã  venir, car les dÃ©cisions de la Cour en grande formation sâ€™imposent Ã  toutes les formations de jugement et Ã  lâ€™ [Office franÃ§ais de protection des rÃ©fugiÃ©s et apatrides](https://www.humanite.fr/social-et-economie/droit-dasile/immigration-les-agents-de-lofpra-en-greve-contre-la-politique-du-chiffre) (Ofpra) Â», explique-t-on Ã  la CNDA. DÃ©jÃ , le 16 janvier 2024, la Cour de Justice de lâ€™Union europÃ©enne avait ouvert la voie en janvier Ã  une telle dÃ©cision dans un arrÃªt qui prÃ©cisait que : Â« Les femmes, dans leur ensemble, peuvent Ãªtre regardÃ©es comme appartenant Ã  un Â« groupe social Â» et prÃ©tendre ainsi au statut de rÃ©fugiÃ© si dans leur pays dâ€™origine elles sont exposÃ©es, en raison de leur sexe, Ã  des violences physiques ou mentales, y compris des violences sexuelles et domestiques Â». Cette dÃ©cision constitue un salutaire retour de balancier. En effet, au lendemain mÃªme de l [a prise du pouvoir par les talibans dÃ©but aoÃ»t 2021](https://www.humanite.fr/monde/afghanistan/en-afghanistan-les-talibans-ont-mis-en-place-un-apartheid-genre-contre-les-femmes-selon-lonu-799703), la CNDA avait placÃ© Â« en dÃ©libÃ©rÃ© prolongÃ© Â» les demandes dâ€™asile en cours des ressortissants afghans. Puis, le 27 aoÃ»t, le Centre de recherche et de documentation de la CNDA prÃ©conisait tout simplement Â« une diminution de la protection des Afghanes et des Afghans au motif dâ€™une Â« cessation du conflit armÃ© ayant opposÃ© les talibans au gouvernement du prÃ©sident Ashraf Ghani Â». Ce qui signifiait que tous ceux et toutes celles qui ne pouvaient prouver des craintes personnelles de persÃ©cution leur permettant dâ€™Ãªtre reconnus comme rÃ©fugiÃ©s sur le fondement de la Convention de GenÃ¨ve et qui craignaient Â« seulement Â» pour leur vie ou leur intÃ©gritÃ© physique en raison de combats entraÃ®nant une Â« violence aveugle Â» verraient leur demande de protection rejetÃ©e. MalgrÃ© cela, lâ€™Afghanistan est demeurÃ©, pour la sixiÃ¨me annÃ©e consÃ©cutive, le premier pays de provenance des demandeurs dâ€™asile en France, avec plus de 17 500 premiÃ¨res demandes introduites et 90 % des demandes de protection aboutissent favorablement. NÃ©anmoins jusquâ€™alors, cette protection concerne majoritairement des hommes, qui reprÃ©sentent plus des deux tiers des ressortissants afghans rÃ©fugiÃ©s en France. Câ€™est pour cela quâ€™Amnesty International demande Ã  la France de faciliter la dÃ©livrance de visas aux femmes afghanes en exil. Â« Cette dÃ©cision de la CNDA rappelle lâ€™importance pour les autoritÃ©s franÃ§aises de tenir leur promesse renouvelÃ©e Ã  plusieurs reprises de rester aux cÃ´tÃ©s des femmes et des filles afghanes. Les rares femmes afghanes qui rÃ©ussissent Ã  fuir dans les pays voisins font face Ã  des arrestations arbitraires, du harcÃ¨lement et le risque dâ€™Ãªtre renvoyÃ©es en Afghanistan Â», rappelle lâ€™ONG dans un communiquÃ©. La Pakistanaise Malala Yousafzai, a de son cotÃ© appelÃ© vendredi 12 juin, le Pakistan, dans une interview Ã  lâ€™AFP, Ã  abandonner sa politique dâ€™expulsion des Afghans sans papiers, afin notamment de protÃ©ger les femmes et les filles face aux talibans. Â« Il est trÃ¨s inquiÃ©tant que le Pakistan force les rÃ©fugiÃ©s afghans Ã  retourner en Afghanistan. Je suis trÃ¨s inquiÃ¨te pour les femmes et les filles Â», a dÃ©clarÃ© vendredi cette femme de 27 ans, qui a reÃ§u le prix Nobel de la paix en 2014 pour son combat pour le droit des filles Ã  lâ€™Ã©ducation. Or, malgrÃ© les promesse dâ€™Emmanuel Macron de Â« ne pas abandonner les femmes et les filles afghanes Â» les visas permettant de rejoindre la France Ã  partir de lâ€˜Iran et du Pakistan sont dÃ©livrÃ©s au compte-goutte et les dÃ©lais pour obtenir un rendez-vous dans les consulats ne cessent de sâ€™allonger. Lâ€™enjeu principal, pour les femmes afghanes qui cherchent protection, est donc de pouvoir se rendre en France par des voies lÃ©gales et sÃ»res. Avant de partir, une derniÃ¨re choseâ€¦ Contrairement Ã  90% des mÃ©dias franÃ§ais aujourdâ€™hui, lâ€™HumanitÃ© ne dÃ©pend ni de grands groupes ni de milliardaires. Cela signifie que : - nous vous apportons des informations impartiales, sans compromis. Mais aussi que - nous nâ€™avons pas les moyens financiers dont bÃ©nÃ©ficient les autres mÃ©dias. Lâ€™information indÃ©pendante et de qualitÃ© a un coÃ»t. Payez-le. [Je veux en savoir plus](https://www.humanite.fr/lhumanite-cest-vous) Les mots-clÃ©s associÃ©s Ã  cet article

author: superscc1
title: St. Clair College and community partners to go 'Honolulu Blue' in support of Detroit Lions' quest for Super Bowl LIX
text:
On the heels of its most successful regular season in franchise history, The Detroit Lions are gearing up for their first playoff game on Jan. 18, 2025, against the Washington Commanders.
And when they take the field Saturday evening at Ford Field, they will have the full backing of Saints Nation.
The St. Clair College Centre for the Arts and the College's Main South Campus will be splashed with a Honolulu blue hue starting on Thursday, Jan. 16, as a show of support for the surging Lions as the team begins its quest for its first-ever Super Bowl title.
"Saints Nation stands with the Detroit Lions as they embark on what we all hope will be a deep push into the playoffs," said St. Clair College President, Michael Silvaggi. "We know firsthand how much it meant to our Saints Football team when fans and the community rallied behind our eventual National Champions."
"We want the Lions to feel that same love from the Windsor-Essex community and hopefully, get the same results."
Caesars Windsor, businesses throughout Windsor-Essex, and the City of Windsor are also showing their pride for 'The Pride' by casting blue light onto their respective buildings.
Staff and students are also encouraged to get into the playoff spirit by donning their favourite Lions swag and colours to school on Friday, Jan. 17. And hopefully, that Friday tradition will continue as the Lions stalk their prey en route to the Vince Lombardi Trophy.
Go Lions!
